results.title: No apple for Johnny
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Dorothy Courtois, Robert Verrall and John Weldon
results.brief_description: This documentary cartoon is the visual enactment of the year-long obstacle course run by a teacher trainee. Rich in humour and anecdote, it is a comedy of educational manners seen through the autobiographical eye of a trainee-turned-filmmaker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Dorothy Courtois, Robert Verrall and John Weldon

results.title: No alternative
results.creator_credit: Tara Fitzpatrick, Red Hot Organisation and MTV
results.brief_description: No Alternative is a collaboration between independent filmmakers and musicians dedicated to raising awareness of issues affecting people living with HIV and AIDS. The video combines live performances, poetry readings and experimental short films. Some highlights include Hal Hartley’s evocative video for The Breeder’s song “Iris”; Tamara Davis’ documentary on the Riot Girls music scene (featuring Courtney Love, Kim Gordon and Huggy Bear); Lou Reed reading his poem “Busload of Faith”; Jennie Livingston’s tribute to lesbian comedy (with music by the Smashing Pumpkins); and Derek Jarman’s poetic super-8 short film based on Patti Smith’s memorial to Robert Mapplethorpe. Music is provided by The Breeders, Smashing Pumpkins, Neneh Cherry, Urge Overkill, Suede, Buffalo Tom and an uncredited Nirvana. This exceptional video manages to be challenging, musically innovative, and informative.

results.title: No act of God...
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rupert Glover, Andy Thomson, Ian Ball and Sidney Goldsmith
results.brief_description: The world is running low on cheap fossil fuels. To the question What else is there?” many scientists have answered, “nuclear power. But some physicists, as well as energy analysts, government consultants, and even law enforcement agencies, are alarmed by the proliferation of nuclear reactors. This film explains various experts’ concerns, among them Dr. Hannes Alfven, Nobel prize-winning physicist. He no longer supports nuclear power, and states most determinedly, “No act of God is permitted.”

results.title: No accidents
results.creator_credit: Scottish Films and Stanley L Russell
results.brief_description: Accidents in factories cause personal suffering and loss of production. Most of them can be prevented by care and forethought. The film shows the kind of accident risks that exist in factories and how they can be prevented.

results.title: Nixon: a self portrait
results.brief_description: Originally telecast by CBS in the latter part of the 1968 presidential campaign, Mr Nixon talks informally about his boyhood and family. He discusses his motivations for running for president and his thoughts on American and presidential responsibilities in the world in the years ahead.

results.title: Nixon [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Andrew G Vajna, Illusion Entertainment Group, Cinergi and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Although he was one of the most famous public figures of this century, Richard Nixon remains a puzzle to many, his decisions and behaviour often shrouded in mystery. Without using a linear chronology, Stone presents many key events from the former leader’s life ranging from his impoverished Quaker boyhood in California and his tense relationship with his hyper-critical father to his involvement in the Watergate affair that led to his eventual downfall. Stone offers an extraordinary portrait of America’s controversial president, a man who desperately craved public acceptance yet never received it.

results.title: Niue
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
Niue is the world’s largest coral atoll and the world’s smallest nation. A New Zealand protectorate from 1901 until 1974, Niue is now self-governing. All Niueans are New Zealand citizens and this has encouraged a trend in depopulation; 10,000 Niueans live in New Zealand, 2,300 live on Niue itself. The island enjoys a high standard of living but is isolated through poor transport and communication links. It also has the problems of a tiny economic base, and trying to retain a cultural identity. The film examines the contemporary issues and challenges facing Niue and its people.

results.title: Nitrous oxide, oxygen, ether, anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
This film shows the working of a typical apparatus designed to deliver a continuous flow on nitrous oxide to the patient. Ether in varied quantities can be added to the mixture of gases as required. One animated diagram sequence in the film deals with the way in which the machine works; another deals with the principle of re-breathing. Induction and maintenance of anaesthesia are demonstrated with emphasis rather on the use of the machine than on general principles.

results.title: Nitric acid
results.creator_credit: Sutherland Educational Films, Chem Study (Manufacturing Chemists Assoc Inc U S A) and Harry H Sisler
results.brief_description: With live action and animation applies fundamental principles to the descriptive chemistry of nitric acid. Demonstrates how nitric acid may act as an acid, as a base, and as an oxidising agent.
